newsitem.title: UK: MOTOR RACING-LOLA TO BUILD FORMULA ONE ENGINE.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-LOLA TO BUILD FORMULA ONE ENGINE.

text.p: Lola, the constructors who helped Nigel Mansell win the 1993 IndyCar title, on Wednesday announced plans to take on Formula One's top engine manufacturers.

The British firm is embarking on a five-year project costing between five million and 10 million pounds ($7.8 million and $15.6 million) it hopes will enable it to rival the likes of Peugeot, Ferrari and Mercedes.
Lola are still considering whether to return to Formula One next season, four years after contesting the 1993 campaign with the BMS Lola Ferrari.
"We continue to evaluate entry, as a team, into Formula One," Lola founder Eric Broadley said. "This long-term engine project will remove any dependence on third-party supply agreements."
Lola Cars were launched by Broadley in 1958 and have won the Indianapolis 500 three times and the IndyCar championship on five occasions.
